input:

14:30 Caption: Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
15:31 Event: Ball out of play
15:40 Caption: A crossfield pass from Xabier Etxeita (Ath Bilbao) fails to find any of his teammates.

17:22 Caption: Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle and signals a foul after Benat (Ath Bilbao) brought his opponent down. Real Madrid are awarded the free kick.
18:23 Caption: Poorly taken free kick by Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) from mid-range. He unleashes a strong shot, but it goes well wide of the right post. What a miskick!

18:25 Event: Shots off target by Real

Real Madrid will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

45:13 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has already been more to see prior to the half-time break than there is in most games during the full 90 minutes. The visitors were more active and dominated the home side in the first half, who weren't able to keep up. The home side focuses on defending and lets the opposition enjoy possession of the ball.

48:19 Caption: The fans can't complain about what they saw on the pitch as both sides displayed a highly captivating football match. The superiority of the away team was evident on the pitch today. The home side was creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks. The tactic of the away side was slow build-up play.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a thrilling encounter at San Mamés Stadium, Athletic Bilbao hosted Real Madrid in a match that lived up to the expectations and provided fans with an enthralling spectacle. The game, which ended with a 2-1 victory for Real Madrid, was filled with dramatic moments, tactical battles, and individual brilliance from key players.

The match kicked off with Real Madrid asserting their dominance early on. Within the first minute, Real committed a foul, setting the tone for what would be a physical contest. Athletic Bilbao capitalized on their free-kick, but Real Madrid quickly regained control. The first real chance of the game for Real came at the 6th minute mark when they registered a shot on target. Athletic Bilbao's goalkeeper, Gorka Iraizoz, was quickly called into action to prevent an early breakthrough.

The first quarter of the match saw a series of fouls and free-kicks from both sides, illustrating the aggressive nature of the contest. Real Madrid, clearly the more dominant side, kept pushing forward. A notable highlight occurred in the 11th minute when Karim Benzema unleashed a long-range effort that forced Gorka Iraizoz into a spectacular save, denying Real Madrid an early lead. Athletic Bilbao's defenders were constantly under pressure, and despite their efforts to clear the ball, Real Madrid continued to mount wave after wave of attacks.

In the 18th minute, Real Madrid's persistence paid off when a catastrophic error by Athletic Bilbao's defense gifted Karim Benzema an easy chance to roll the ball into the back of the net, giving Real Madrid a 1-0 lead. Athletic Bilbao quickly sought to equalize, but their efforts were thwarted by Real Madrid's organized defense.

Despite being on the back foot, Athletic Bilbao managed to create a few chances of their own. Raul Garcia and Aritz Aduriz both had efforts on goal, but failed to convert. Real Madrid, on the other hand, continued to press. Cristiano Ronaldo and Benzema were constantly threatening, with the latter hitting the target multiple times, only to be denied by Iraizoz's heroics.

As the first half progressed, Real Madrid's midfield maestros, Luka Modric and Toni Kroos, dictated play, creating opportunities and maintaining possession. Athletic Bilbao struggled to keep up with Real Madrid's pace and precision, relying on counter-attacks and set-pieces to create chances. However, they were unable to breach Real Madrid's defense, and the first half ended with Real maintaining their one-goal advantage.

The second half began with Athletic Bilbao kicking off and immediately looking to level the score. A rough challenge by Real Madrid's Cristiano Ronaldo earned him a yellow card, showcasing the intensity with which both teams were playing. Athletic Bilbao's tactical adjustments paid dividends in the 58th minute when a beautiful lofted cross by Markel Susaeta found Sabin, who converted it with a precise header to equalize the score at 1-1.

However, Real Madrid's response was swift and decisive. Just over a minute later, Isco laid the ball off to Karim Benzema, who slotted it into the back of the net from close range, restoring Real Madrid's lead to 2-1. This goal showcased Benzema's poaching instincts and highlighted the fluid attacking play of Real Madrid.

Both teams made substitutions soon after in an attempt to freshen up their squads and gain an upper hand. Real Madrid brought on Jese and Casemiro, while Athletic Bilbao introduced Mikel Rico and later Gomez Perez Ibai. The changes injected new energy into the match, with both teams creating chances in quick succession.

Athletic Bilbao kept pushing for an equalizer, with Aritz Aduriz coming close on several occasions. Real Madrid's defense, marshaled by Pepe and Raphael Varane, held firm, while Keylor Navas made crucial saves to keep his team in front. The physicality of the match remained evident with several players receiving yellow cards, including Real Madrid's Pepe and Toni Kroos, as well as Athletic Bilbao's Benat and Raul Garcia.

The final stages of the match saw Athletic Bilbao throwing everything forward in search of a second goal. Real Madrid, however, managed the game well, using their experience to maintain possession and run down the clock. Athletic’s Gomez Perez Ibai delivered a towering header towards the top left corner in the dying moments, but Keylor Navas was equal to the task, making a fantastic save to preserve Real Madrid's lead.

In the end, Real Madrid's ability to capitalize on their chances and maintain composure under pressure proved decisive. Athletic Bilbao played valiantly and created several opportunities, but lacked the clinical finishing required to change the scoreline. The game ended with Real Madrid securing a hard-fought 2-1 victory, much to the delight of their traveling fans.

The match statistics revealed Real Madrid's dominance in attack, with numerous shots on target and superior possession, while Athletic Bilbao's resilience and determination were evident from their spirited performance. The tactical battle between the managers was fascinating, with both teams showcasing different styles of play. Athletic Bilbao relied on fast counter-attacks and exploiting set-pieces, whereas Real Madrid favoured slow build-up play and maintaining control through their midfield maestros.

The win was crucial for Real Madrid, helping them to maintain momentum in their pursuit of the league title. Key players like Karim Benzema, Isco, and Cristiano Ronaldo delivered when it mattered most, while the defense and goalkeeper Keylor Navas held firm under pressure. For Athletic Bilbao, it was a case of missed opportunities and the need to fine-tune their finishing in future matches.

Overall, the match was a testament to the high level of competition in La Liga, with both teams displaying high-quality football and providing entertainment to the fans. The intensity, skill, and tactical acumen on display made it a memorable encounter, highlighting why football remains the beautiful game.
